parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
Opportunely, in season, conveniently. Adverb from eukairos; opportunely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
